channel.title: Tag: advertising - blog.lmorchard.com
channel.description: It's all spinning wheels & self-doubt until the first pot of coffee.

item.title: Ruining YouTube on purpose
item.description:
Android Authority, "YouTube’s new ads will ruin the best part of a video on purpose":

YouTube is always cooking up new ways to show you ads. Be it skippable ads, non-skippable ads, mid-rolls, or bumpers, the goal, as always, is to find more places to make more money. And now, thanks to AI, YouTube has found a brand-new spot to squeeze in ads — right when something exciting happens in a video.

I don't think I quite understand the point of ads on YouTube, these days. Are they there to get me to think favorably of an advertiser and buy something from them? Or are they there to annoy me into paying for YouTube Premium? Does this make anyone happy?

item.title: Catbearcoin, a web science fiction story
item.description: <html><head></head><body>TL;DR: Wherein I write a web sci-fi story about how I imagine micropayments could work.</body></html>

item.title: The web is awesome
item.description: <html><head></head><body>TL;DR: The open web is a beautiful thing that empowers makers while offering users leverage. There's nothing else like it. It's constantly improving. It's up to you what you do with it.</body></html>

item.title: The Verge's web sucks
item.description: <html><head></head><body>TL;DR: Did you know that The Verge delivers you to around 20 companies for advertising & tracking purposes? I didn't. That might foul up your web experience a little bit. Maybe we should try something different.</body></html>

item.title: I can't get too ticked at O'Reilly and IntelliTXT
